channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrowth making it difficult to pass others, 26th June
item.description:
Faraday Avenue is very busy at school drop off and pick up times. The overgrown weeds and trees are making the pavement single file in places. This makes it difficult for me to pass by others with my pushchair. This is not ideal as at certain times this pavement is very busy with people trying to go in both directions, adults holding hands with young children, pushchairs/prams and older children on bikes and scooters. Some of the weeds are prickly. Please can the council arrange to cut this back.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Cleeve Park Gardens, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping being left side of my house, 26th June
item.description:

item.title: Car abandoned for months never moves, 26th June
item.description:
Vehicle LN58XPF BMW 520d Silver, has been left on the road outside number 31 Rainbow Road. The Vehicle does not have any road TAX or current MOT and is declared SORN but is on the carriageway and has been there for months. The road around the car has debris and weeds around it and it looks a mess.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rainbow Road, Slade Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing repeator signs, 26th June
item.description:
Colours Lane is a 20 mile limit, so in line with the highway code, repeator signs should be there, as it is not the default 30 mile. I am sure this would slow traffic down, making drivers realise that this road is actually slower than the side streets. The signage on entering the 20 zone can easily be missed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colyers Lane, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dirty road left from gas & water works, 26th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Heath Way, Northumberland Heath, London
